books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The 10th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series looks at organized crime in the United States during the 20th century.
books.name: KILLING THE MOB

books.author: by Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: A look at the key players and outcomes of precision bombing during World War II.
books.name: THE BOMBER MAFIA

books.author: by Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.
books.name: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
books.name: CASTE

books.author: by Michael Lewis
books.description: Stories of skeptics who went against the official response of the Trump administration to the outbreak of Covid-19. The profiles include a local public-health officer and a group of doctors nicknamed the Wolverines.
books.name: THE PREMONITION

books.author: by Michelle Zauner
books.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.
books.name: CRYING IN H MART

books.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
books.name: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS

books.author: by John Green
books.description: A collection of personal essays that review different facets of the human-centered planet.
books.name: THE ANTHROPOCENE REVIEWED

books.author: by Clint Smith
books.description: A staff writer at The Atlantic explores the legacy of slavery and its imprint on centuries of American history.
books.name: HOW THE WORD IS PASSED

books.author: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it.
books.name: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: by Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”
books.name: BORN A CRIME

books.author: by Adam Grant
books.description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.
books.name: THINK AGAIN

books.author: by Annette Gordon-Reed
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize winner weaves together American history with personal memoir to show the importance of events in Galveston, Texas, on June 19, 1865.
books.name: ON JUNETEENTH
